metadata.title: CVE-2020-1739 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in Ansible 2.7.16 and prior, 2.8.8 and prior, and 2.9.5 and prior when a password is set with the argument "password" of svn module, it is used on svn command line, disclosing to other users within the same node. An attacker could take advantage by reading the cmdline file from that particular PID on the procfs.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-1739` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ansible - 2.9.7+dfsg-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ansible package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.9.7+dfsg-1').
